answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a few links that may be a helpful start to your research.
Utah’s Cities and Towns have formed a branding campaign which includes selling merchandise to local communities. You may also want to contact them for more specific information about the program. 
http://www.ulct.org/ulct/docs/LifeBetter.pdf
Spartanburg, South Carolina sold shirts and other merchandise as part of their community brand. You can read more about their process in the first case study from this report. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2889/Brandstanding_Four_Cities_Share_Their_Success
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Richard Hoon
text:
The City of Eustis Florida has a trademarked marketing brand logo. We have 3 local business vendors who are authorized to prepare items at the request of the City for specific uses such as employee shirts, hats, etc. However, during the past few months, we have had requests from several residents and visitors that would like to purchase items with our brand on it to show their pride and to give as gifts or souvenirs.
The City of Eustis Florida has a trademarked marketing brand logo. We have 3 local business vendors who are authorized to prepare items at the request of the City for specific uses such as employee shirts, hats, etc. However, during the past few months, we have had requests from several residents and visitors that would like to purchase items with our brand on it to show their pride and to give as gifts or souvenirs.
With that in mind, we are considering an online store through the City’s website that would offer a limited amount of approved items for public purchase, or possibly contracting with several local merchants as authorized sellers, as well as our Chamber of Commerce and historical museum. This would not be so much as a profit venture as we would only make a percentage of the product cost, but rather a brand awareness campaign.
Does anyone have any experience with this? I would love to see examples, if any, of where this was actually done!
title: City marketing through online store
